categories: Category:Confederacy of Independent Systems star systems

nodes.text: The Ando system was a star system located in the Lambda sector, a part of the regions known as the Mid Rim and the Slice. It lay in grid square Q-15 of the Standard Galactic Grid and contained the planet Ando, the aquatic homeworld of the Aqualish species.

During the Separatist Crisis, a period of turmoil occurred on Ando that staggered the rest of the galaxy. As a result, the Ando system and the Hyper-Communications Cartel seceded from the Galactic Republic to the Confederacy of Independent Systems through the influence of Aqualish Senator Po Nudo, who had represented Ando in the Galactic Senate during the time of the Clone Wars between the Republic and Confederacy.

The Ando system was first mentioned in the new Star Wars canon in Rise of the Separatists, a 2019 supplement to Fantasy Flight Games' series of Star Wars Roleplaying products. The system was first mentioned in the Star Wars Legends continuity in The Last Command, a 1993 novel written by Timothy Zahn as the final volume of Star Wars: The Thrawn Trilogy. The Ando system later made its first appearance in "Courier's Deal," a short companion narrative published in the 1994 West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game sourcebook Creatures of the Galaxy.
